subject: Re: [junit] Re: Producing a diff report after comparing two junit 	results?
msgSnippet: Can you use ant to generate html, and then xmldiff to diff them? David Saff On Mon, Jul 20, 2009 at 12:46 AM,
messageBody:
Can you use ant to generate html, and then xmldiff to diff them?

David Saff

On Mon, Jul 20, 2009 at 12:46 AM,
rohitkulkarni15<rohitkulkarni15@...> wrote:
> Thanks Jim,
>
> Yes - the problem is that I need to incorporate this in a script and produce a diff file as a output of this script.
>
> Thanks,
> Rohit
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "cant_jim" <jimcant@...> wrote:
>>
>> I assume these reports are in files. Couldn't you just 'diff' them (assuming your on a nice *nix system; I guess on Windows you need to resort to WinDiff) or is there something I don't understand about the problem
>>    diff -bw ReportA ReportB
>> should do the trick.  You'll get differences between them if the running times of tests are different but the serious differences should be obvious.
>>
>> Are you going to asses the differences visually or is this going to be in a script; if the latter, the problem is more interesting (i.e. harder).
>>
>> Hope this helps
>>
>> jim
>>
>> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "rohitkulkarni15" <rohitkulkarni15@> wrote:
>> >
>> > Hi,
>> >
>> > Currently, I have a requirement of comparing results of two JUnit reports(with same set of tests).
>> > The result of this comparison activity should be to generate a diff report that mentions only those tests whose status is different as compared to the 1st result
>> >
>> > i.e. If i have report A and report B, how to get the list of differences between these two reports.
>> >
>> > Can someone please guide me on how to do this?
>> >
>> > Thanks,
>> > Rohit
>> >
>>
>
>
>
>
